intro: Neea coccinea var. hirtifolia, commonly known as the red neea or hairy red neea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy foliage, which is a distinguishing feature of the hirtifolia variety. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of tropical flora.
